intro: Papuacalia yuleensis, commonly known as Yule's papuacalia, is a flowering plant native to the highlands of Ecuador. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae, which includes bellflowers and related genera. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and clusters of small, white to pale blue flowers. It typically grows in rocky or open habitats at elevations above 2,500 meters. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
